original_title: C Compiler Exists Entirely in Vim
original_content:
8cc.vim is a C compiler that exists as pure Vimscript. Is it small? It sure is! How about fast? Absolutely not! Efficient? Also no. But does it work and is it neat? You betcha!
Ever typed :wq to write the buffer and exit in Vim? When you do that, youre using Vimscript. Whenever one enters command mode : in Vim, one is in fact using a live Vimscript interpreter. Thats the space in which this project exists and does its magic. Given enough time, anyway.
Vimscript itself was created by [Bram Moolenaar] in 1991. The idea was to execute batches of vim commands programmatically. Its been used for a variety of purposes since then.
8cc is a lightweight C compiler that has been supplanted by chibicc, but that doesnt matter much because as author [rhysd] admits, this is really just a fun concept project more than anything. It may take twenty minutes or more to compile hello world, but doing it entirely from within Vim is a trip.
title: 8cc.vim: Vimscriptで動作する軽量なCコンパイラ
body: 8cc.vimは、Vimscriptで存在するCコンパイラで、小さく、高速でも効率的でもないが、機能し、整然としている。Vimのコマンドモードで:を入力するとVimscriptを使用しており、8ccはその領域で動作する。作者はこのプロジェクトを楽しい概念プロジェクトと述べている。
titles: 8cc.vim: Vimscriptで動作する軽量なCコンパイラ
Vimscriptで作成されたCコンパイラ8cc.vim
Vimscriptを使った楽しいプロジェクト: 8cc.vim
8cc.vim: Vimscriptを使った軽量Cコンパイラ
chibiccに取って代わられたが魅力的なプロジェクト: 8cc.vim
